ci_support_linux_c_compilergcccxx_compil:
build_number_decrement:
- '0'
c_compiler:
- gcc
channel_sources:
- conda-forge/label/gcc7,defaults
channel_targets:
- conda-forge gcc7
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
docker_image:
- conda/c3i-linux-64
pin_run_as_build:
  snappy:
    max_pin: x.x.x
snappy:
- 1.1.7
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler
  - cxx_compiler
  - channel_sources
  - channel_targets
  - docker_image
  - build_number_decrement

about.description:
Snzip is one of command line tools using snappy. This supports several file
formats; framing-format, old framing-format, hadoop-snappy format, raw
format and obsolete three formats used by snzip, snappy-java and
snappy-in-java before official framing-format was defined. The default
format is framing-format.
about.summary: Snzip, a compression/decompression tool based on snappy

about.description:
Snzip is one of command line tools using snappy. This supports several file
formats; framing-format, old framing-format, hadoop-snappy format, raw
format and obsolete three formats used by snzip, snappy-java and
snappy-in-java before official framing-format was defined. The default
format is framing-format.
about.summary: Snzip, a compression/decompression tool based on snappy

name: snzip

about.description:
Snzip is one of command line tools using snappy. This supports several file
formats; framing-format, old framing-format, hadoop-snappy format, raw
format and obsolete three formats used by snzip, snappy-java and
snappy-in-java before official framing-format was defined. The default
format is framing-format.
about.summary: Snzip, a compression/decompression tool based on snappy

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set author = "kubo" %}
{% set name = "snzip" %}
{% set version = "1.0.4" %}
{% set hash_type = "sha256" %}
{% set hash_val = "a45081354715d48ed31899508ebed04a41d4b4a91dca37b79fc3b8ee0c02e25e" %}

package:
  name: {{ name }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.bz2
  url: https://bintray.com/{{ author }}/generic/download_file?file_path={{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  {{ hash_type }}: {{ hash_val }}

build:
  number: 1001
  skip: True  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler("c") }}
    - {{ compiler("cxx") }}

  host:
    - snappy

  run:
    - snappy

test:
  commands:
    - snzip -h

about:
  home: https://github.com/kubo/snzip
  license: BSD 2-Clause
  license_file: COPYING
  summary: Snzip, a compression/decompression tool based on snappy
  description: |
    Snzip is one of command line tools using snappy. This supports several file
    formats; framing-format, old framing-format, hadoop-snappy format, raw
    format and obsolete three formats used by snzip, snappy-java and
    snappy-in-java before official framing-format was defined. The default
    format is framing-format.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - rmax
